choices.text:
### Human:
Tom washed 10 pairs of socks. The socks are now wet from the wash, so Tom hangs the 10 pairs of socks outside to dry. 10 hours later, he comes back outside to check on the socks. He feels each sock and notices they are all dry. He takes them back inside because they are all dry. How long will it take Tom to dry seven pairs of socks presuming the same weather conditions?
### Assistant:

If Tom washed 10 pairs of socks, then he has a total of 20 socks (10 pairs x 2 socks per pair). 
Let's assume that each sock takes the same amount of time to dry. Then it will take 20 hours for all 20 socks to dry if they are hung outside in the same weather conditions. 

If Tom wants to dry seven pairs of socks, then he has a total of 14 socks (7 pairs x 2 socks per pair). 
It will still take 14 hours for these socks to dry if they are hung outside in the same weather conditions.<|im_end|>
